snippet: Japan has slashed its whale catch target in the Antarctic by two-thirds in a bid to resume its annual whale hunt, which an international court ruled must stop.
abstract: Japan slashes its whale catch target in Antarctic by two-thirds in bid to resume its annual hunt, which it claims is needed to collect scientific data; International Court of Justice had ruled whaling must stop because it was not scientific.
lead_paragraph: Japan has slashed its whale catch target in the Antarctic by two-thirds in a bid to resume its annual whale hunt, which an international court ruled must stop.

headline.main: Japan: Plan for Antarctic Whale Hunt Slashes Target Numbers for Catch
headline.print_headline: Japan: Plan for Antarctic Whale Hunt Slashes Target Numbers for Catch
